page.title: 07CHANGE IN INDUSTRY IN RYTON
page.content: Coal mining was once a major industry in the North East of England, begun in fact by the monks hundreds of years ago. The last pit in the Ryton area, Emma Pit, was closed in 1968 when reserves were found to be exhausted. There is much evidence of this industry throughout the area. The old Townley Main Railway line, which ran from the fells above Hedley to the staithes on the Tyne, is still recognisable, and other old wagonways near Greenside can also be traced. The changing industry over the last few years can be clearly seen where Stargate Pit once stood. This site now has several small factories making a variety of products. A building supplies firm moved here to avoid high rates in Newcastle, anda firm specialising in Computer hard and software came here 16 years ago.
